what: Element UI (Vue2) Integration Helpers for Shiny via vueR
title: Element UI (Vue2) Integration Helpers for Shiny via vueR
text: shiny.element provides R/Shiny bindings Element-UI (Vue2) components, enabling modern, interactive, flexible UI development Shiny apps.

title: Element UI (Vue2) Integration Helpers for Shiny via vueR
code: remotes::install_github("kaipingyang/shiny.element")

title: Element UI (Vue2) Integration Helpers for Shiny via vueR
text: Element-UI buttons, tables, cascader, layout components Shiny Automatic Vue mounting—manual setup required Shiny module namespace support Seamless integration Shiny’s reactive system

title: Element UI (Vue2) Integration Helpers for Shiny via vueR
code: library(shiny) library(shiny.element)  cascader_options <- list(   list(     value = "guide",     label = "Guide",     children = list(       list(value = "principle", label = "Principle"),       list(value = "navigation", label = "Navigation")     )   ),   list(     value = "component",     label = "Component",     children = list(       list(value = "basic", label = "Basic"),       list(value = "form", label = "Form")     )   ) )  ui <- fluidPage(   use_element(),   el_button(id = "button1", label = "Click Me"),   el_cascader(     id = "cascader1",     options = cascader_options,     placeholder = "Please select",     clearable = TRUE   ),   el_table(     id = "table1",     data = list(       list(RowName = "A", Value = 1),       list(RowName = "B", Value = 2)     ),     columns = list(       list(prop = "RowName", label = "Row Name", width = "120"),       list(prop = "Value", label = "Value", width = "80")     )   )  )  server <- function(input, output, session) {   observeEvent(input$button1, {     showNotification(paste("Button clicked!", "Count:", input$button1))   }) }  shinyApp(ui, server)

title: Element UI (Vue2) Integration Helpers for Shiny via vueR
code: library(shiny) library(shiny.element)  cascader_options <- list(   list(     value = "guide",     label = "Guide",     children = list(       list(value = "principle", label = "Principle"),       list(value = "navigation", label = "Navigation")     )   ),   list(     value = "component",     label = "Component",     children = list(       list(value = "basic", label = "Basic"),       list(value = "form", label = "Form")     )   ) )  ui <- el_page(   el_button(id = "button1", label = "Click Me"),   el_cascader(     id = "cascader1",     options = cascader_options,     placeholder = "Please select",     clearable = TRUE   ),   el_table(     id = "table1",     data = list(       list(RowName = "A", Value = 1),       list(RowName = "B", Value = 2)     ),     columns = list(       list(prop = "RowName", label = "Row Name", width = "120"),       list(prop = "Value", label = "Value", width = "80")     )   ) )  server <- function(input, output, session) {   observeEvent(input$button1, {     showNotification(paste("Button clicked!", "Count:", input$button1))   }) }  shinyApp(ui, server)

what: Using bslib Layouts with Element-UI Components
title: Element UI (Vue2) Integration Helpers for Shiny via vueR
text: can use Element-UI components (el_button) inside bslib layouts. Just call use_element() top UI load required dependencies, use Element-UI widgets inside bslib layout functions: Note: Element-UI layout functions (el_container, el_row, el_col) experimental fundamentally different bslib’s layout system (page_sidebar, layout_columns). directly nested mixed. use cases, prefer bslib layouts Element-UI components. Element-UI layout functions may deprecated future releases.
code: library(shiny) library(shiny.element) library(bslib)  cascader_options <- list(   list(     value = "guide",     label = "Guide",     children = list(       list(value = "principle", label = "Principle"),       list(value = "navigation", label = "Navigation")     )   ),   list(     value = "component",     label = "Component",     children = list(       list(value = "basic", label = "Basic"),       list(value = "form", label = "Form")     )   ) )  ui <- page_sidebar(   use_element(), # Loads Element-UI dependencies   sidebar = sidebar(     el_button("sidebar_btn", "Sidebar Button", type = "primary")   ),   layout_columns(     col_widths = c(4, 4, 12),     row_heights = c(2, 8),     el_button("btn1", "Primary", type = "primary"),     el_cascader(       id = "cascader1",       options = cascader_options,       placeholder = "Please select",       clearable = TRUE     ),     el_table(       id = "table1",       data = list(         list(RowName = "A", Value = 1),         list(RowName = "B", Value = 2)       ),       columns = list(         list(prop = "RowName", label = "Row Name", width = "120"),         list(prop = "Value", label = "Value", width = "80")       )     )   ) )  server <- function(input, output, session) {   observeEvent(input$button1, {     showNotification(paste("Button clicked!", "Count:", input$button1))   }) }  shinyApp(ui, server)

title: Element UI (Vue2) Integration Helpers for Shiny via vueR
text: el_button(): Element-UI Button el_table(): Element-UI Table el_cascader(): Element-UI Cascader el_header(), el_main(), el_footer(), el_aside(): Element-UI Layout Containers (may deprecated future releases)

text: df Data frame hierarchical columns value_cols Character vector value column names (e.g. c("value1", "value2", ...)) label_cols Character vector label column names (e.g. c("label1", "label2", ...)), can NULL contain NA levels without label

what: Element UI Page Wrapper with Theme Support — el_page
title: Element UI Page Wrapper with Theme Support — el_page
text: Top-level page constructor loads Element-UI, Vue, layout CSS dependencies, supports bslib/shiny themes Element-UI layout CSS.

title: Element UI Page Wrapper with Theme Support — el_page
code: el_page(   ...,   title = NULL,   theme = bslib::bs_theme(version = 5, bootswatch = "minty"),   theme_css = el_layout_css_dependency() )

title: Element UI Page Wrapper with Theme Support — el_page
text: ... UI elements include page body. title Optional page title. theme Optional bslib shiny theme object (e.g., bs_theme()) Bootstrap styling. provided, Bootstrap dependencies included. theme_css Optional Element-UI layout CSS dependency (default: el_layout_css_dependency()). Set NULL disable Element-UI layout CSS.

title: Element UI Page Wrapper with Theme Support — el_page
text: Use root UI function Shiny app. can combine bslib layouts (page_sidebar, layout_columns) Element-UI widgets (el_button). el_page function designed work bslib layouts Element-UI widgets. mix Element-UI layout functions (el_container, el_row, el_col) bslib layouts, compatible. Element-UI layout functions experimental may deprecated future.

what: Load All Element-UI Dependencies Convenience function to load Vue, Element-UI, and layout CSS dependencies. Use this when you want to use Element-UI components in non-el_page layouts (e.g., bslib::page_sidebar, shiny::navbarPage). — use_element
title: Load All Element-UI Dependencies Convenience function to load Vue, Element-UI, and layout CSS dependencies. Use this when you want to use Element-UI components in non-el_page layouts (e.g., bslib::page_sidebar, shiny::navbarPage). — use_element
text: Load Element-UI Dependencies Convenience function load Vue, Element-UI, layout CSS dependencies. Use want use Element-UI components non-el_page layouts (e.g., bslib::page_sidebar, shiny::navbarPage).

title: Load All Element-UI Dependencies Convenience function to load Vue, Element-UI, and layout CSS dependencies. Use this when you want to use Element-UI components in non-el_page layouts (e.g., bslib::page_sidebar, shiny::navbarPage). — use_element
code: use_element(theme = el_layout_css_dependency())

title: Load All Element-UI Dependencies Convenience function to load Vue, Element-UI, and layout CSS dependencies. Use this when you want to use Element-UI components in non-el_page layouts (e.g., bslib::page_sidebar, shiny::navbarPage). — use_element
text: theme CSS dependency function list (optional, default el_layout_css_dependency())

title: Load All Element-UI Dependencies Convenience function to load Vue, Element-UI, and layout CSS dependencies. Use this when you want to use Element-UI components in non-el_page layouts (e.g., bslib::page_sidebar, shiny::navbarPage). — use_element
text: list htmlDependency objects

title: Load All Element-UI Dependencies Convenience function to load Vue, Element-UI, and layout CSS dependencies. Use this when you want to use Element-UI components in non-el_page layouts (e.g., bslib::page_sidebar, shiny::navbarPage). — use_element
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{   library(bslib)   ui <- page_sidebar(     use_element(),     el_button("btn1", "Click me")   )   } # }

title: Vue Handler Dependency — vue_handler_dependency
text: Registers custom JavaScript handlers Shiny--Vue communication. dependency loads vue_handlers.js, enables R update Vue component fields entire data objects via update_vue_component update_vue_data custom messages. included UI (typically via use_element()) ensure Vue update handlers available.

title: Vue Handler Dependency — vue_handler_dependency
code: vue_handler_dependency()

title: Vue Handler Dependency — vue_handler_dependency
text: htmlDependency object vue_handlers.js
